attributes.action: Do not implement the proposed increase in minimum income for family visas
attributes.additional_details: The government should scrap any plans to raise the minimum income amount for family visas, that is already set at high enough level (£18,600) as it is anyway. The rise to over £38,000 is a ridiculously high rise, and affects hard working honest people who simply want to lawfully live with their loved ones.
attributes.background: The government should scrap the plan to raise the minimum income required for family visas. A rise from £18,600 to over £38,000 is completely unjust and unethical, and puts a very difficult and immoral barrier in front of people who simply want to legally live with their loved ones.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition -

Don’t increase the income requirement for family visas to £38,700: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/652602
